data.title: Photographs, Autographs, Printed & Manuscript Ephemera Auctions & Valuations at Toovey’s in West Sussex
data.text:
LOT 3324

PHOTOGRAPHS. An album titled on the upper cover 'A Cruise to the West Indies', containing approximately 77 black and white photographs, most 11.5cm x 16cm, including photographs captioned 'Madeira', 'Tobago', 'Trinidad', 'Jamaica', 'St Kitts', 'St Lucia', 'Grenada' and 'Post Office, Casablanca'.

Hammer Price: £140

( Plus

Buyer’s Premium

Buyer’s Premium is an additional charge on each lot sold, currently this is set at 24.5% plus VAT (29.4% including VAT) of the hammer price.

)

LOT 3325

PHOTOGRAPHS. An album titled on the upper cover 'P & O Chusan Cruise' containing approximately 278 black and white photographs, circa 1960s, the majority 11.5cm x 16cm on leaves 30.5cm x 38cm, including views of Aden, Bombay, Penang, Singapore, Bermuda, Manila, Hong Kong, San Francisco, Vancouver, Panama and views on board the ship.

Hammer Price: £150

( Plus

Buyer’s Premium

Buyer’s Premium is an additional charge on each lot sold, currently this is set at 24.5% plus VAT (29.4% including VAT) of the hammer price.

)

LOT 3326

AUTOGRAPHS. A 7 line hand-written letter by George Bernard Shaw on 'Queen's Hotel, Manchester' headed writing paper, dated Dec 1918, 20.5cm x 12cm, Shaw writes 'Dear Madam, All my election readings are in the provinces. I presume you do not wish to travel a hundred miles to see me'. He goes on to say that he might be speaking for Dr. Haden-Guest in London at a future date, together with a further 35 line letter, typed and signed by J.B. Priestley regarding objections to his distaste for semi-detached houses which 'make London so big it takes a day to get out of it'.

Hammer Price: £280

( Plus

Buyer’s Premium

Buyer’s Premium is an additional charge on each lot sold, currently this is set at 24.5% plus VAT (29.4% including VAT) of the hammer price.

)

LOT 3327

PHOTOGRAPHS. An album of 48 photographs measuring 13.5 x 8cm, relating to Kenya, circa 1911, including several of Kenyans in tribal and military dress, a photograph of Roosevelt's camp, colonial residences in 'Fort Hall' (Murang'a), topographical views of Mount Kenya and the Chania Falls, all captioned in ink on the mount, together with a further 15 photographs of Kenyan scenes loosely inserted.

Hammer Price: £100

( Plus

Buyer’s Premium

Buyer’s Premium is an additional charge on each lot sold, currently this is set at 24.5% plus VAT (29.4% including VAT) of the hammer price.

)

LOT 3328

MANUSCRIPT. An early typed draft by Clemence Dane of the film script for 'Jamaica Inn', directed by Alfred Hitchcock, and based on the novel by Daphne du Maurier, 188pp. dated 1st July 1938, leaves 32.5cm x 20cm, and typed on recto with 1p. hand-drawn plan of 'Jamaica Inn'. Note: 'Clemence Dane' was the pseudonym of Winifred Ashton, screenwriter and novelist. Winifred had written the screenplay for 'Anna Karenina' starring Greta Garbo in 1935. However, she wasn't credited with the writing of 'Jamaica Inn'. The writing was attributed to Joan Harrison, Sidney Gilliat, Alma Reville and J.B. Priestley. Starring Charles Laughton and Maureen O'Hara the film was released in 1939. Soon afterwards Hitchcock left for America but was to direct two more films based on the work of du Maurier. Provenance: by family repute, from the estate of Marius Goring, actor. Together with a further typed and bound screenplay by Clemence Dane and Sergei Nolbandov ('Kean').

Hammer Price: £190

( Plus

Buyer’s Premium

Buyer’s Premium is an additional charge on each lot sold, currently this is set at 24.5% plus VAT (29.4% including VAT) of the hammer price.

)

LOT 3329

PHOTOGRAPHS. - A collection of early 20th century photographs in eleven albums, mostly snapshot-size, the majority British topographical views or of social history interest, including some of Sussex and Hampshire, others of general family life and occasional holidays and one of Lord Brassey's Yacht Sunbeam off Hastings.

Hammer Price: £25

( Plus

Buyer’s Premium

Buyer’s Premium is an additional charge on each lot sold, currently this is set at 24.5% plus VAT (29.4% including VAT) of the hammer price.

)

LOT 3330

OPTICAL TOY. A group of 19th century Fantascope discs, comprising a set of six hand-coloured discs and their original slip folder by T.T. Bury, published by Ackermann & Co, diameter of discs 24cm, the interior printed with instructions dated 1833, together with ten smaller discs, mostly hand-coloured, diameters 18cm, and a Compass Navigating disc, diameter 13cm (lacking handle).

Hammer Price: £850

( Plus

Buyer’s Premium

Buyer’s Premium is an additional charge on each lot sold, currently this is set at 24.5% plus VAT (29.4% including VAT) of the hammer price.

)

LOT 3338

GAME. A hand-coloured engraved game 'Wallis's Elegant and Instructive Game exhibiting the Wonders of Art, in Each Quarter of the World', circa 1810, printed in 12 sections and backed onto linen, overall 47cm x 62cm, folding within a card slipcase.

Hammer Price: £380

( Plus

Buyer’s Premium

Buyer’s Premium is an additional charge on each lot sold, currently this is set at 24.5% plus VAT (29.4% including VAT) of the hammer price.

)
